member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.JobHost
member.summary: Defines properties and methods to locate Job methods and listen to trigger events in order to execute Job methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.JobHost.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using a Microsoft Azure Storage connection string located in the connectionStrings section of the configuration file or in environment variables.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the configuration provided.
member.param: The job host configuration.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the service provider provided.
member.param: The service provider.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.JobHost.RunOnBackgroundThread
member.summary: Runs the jobs on a background thread and return immediately. The trigger listeners and jobs will execute on the background thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.JobHost.RunOnBackgroundThread(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Runs the jobs on a background thread and return immediately. The trigger listeners and jobs will execute on the background thread. The thread exits when the cancellation token is signalled.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.JobHost.RunAndBlock
member.summary: Runs the jobs on the current thread. The trigger listeners and jobs will execute on the current thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.JobHost.RunAndBlock(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Runs the jobs on the current thread. The trigger listeners and jobs will execute on the current thread. The thread will be blocked until the cancellation token is signalled.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.JobHost.Call(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Invokes a job function.
member.param: A MethodInfo representing the job method to execute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.JobHost.Call(System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: Invokes a job function.
member.param: A MethodInfo representing the job method to execute.
An object with public properties representing argument names and values to bind to parameters in the job method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.JobHost.Call(System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Invokes a job function.
member.param: A MethodInfo representing the job method to execute.
The argument names and values to bind to parameters in the job method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.JobHost.Call(System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Invokes a job function.
member.param: A MethodInfo representing the job method to execute.
An object with public properties representing argument names and values to bind to the parameter tokens in the job method's arguments.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.JobHost.Call(System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Invokes a job function.
member.param: A MethodInfo representing the job method to execute.
The argument names and values to bind to parameters in the job method.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerType
member.summary: Define the kind of trigger

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerType.Blob
member.summary: Blob trigger, invoked when an input blob is detected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerType.Queue
member.summary: Queue Trigger, invoked when a new queue mesasge is detected

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerType.ServiceBus
member.summary: Service Bus trigger, on a message in a subscription or queue.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerRaw
member.summary: Wire protocol for an serializing triggers. Irrelevant fields should reamin null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerRaw.NewBlob(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new trigger on blobs. This fires the callback if a new input blob is detected. The http content is the string name of the blob path that was detected. For example, if input is 'container/{name}.txt', and output is 'container/outputs/{nane}.txt;
member.param: An input path to search for. The blob name can include 'route parameters' for pattern matching, is and of the form 'container/blob'.
A semicolon delimited list of output paths. The trigger is not fired if all outputs are newer than the input. This can have route parameters which are populated from the capture at the input values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerRaw.NewQueue(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new trigger on queue message. This fires the callback when a new queue message is detected, where the http request contents are the azure queue message contents. The azure message is deleted if the callback is invoked.
member.param: The azure queue to listen on. Be sure to adhere to azure queue naming rules, including being all lowercase.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerRaw.Type
member.summary: Define what type of trigger. Serializing can emit as either the raw number or the name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerRaw.BlobInput
member.summary: For Blobs, blob path for the input. This is of the form "container/blob"

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerRaw.BlobOutput
member.summary: For Blobs, optional. semicolon delimited list of blob paths for the output. This is of the form "container1/blob1;container2/blob2" The trigger is not fired if all outputs have a more recent modified timestamp than the input.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerRaw.QueueName
member.summary: For Queues. The name of the azure queue. Be sure to follow azure queue naming rules, including all lowercase.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Jobs.TriggerRaw.EntityName
member.summary: For Service Bus. The name of the entity (queue or topic/subscription).
